images.copyright: Bridge of Sighs in Venice, Italy (© Doug Pearson/Alamy)
images.title: A kiss and a sigh
images.caption: Bridge of Sighs in Venice, Italy
images.desc: Beneath Venice's Ponte dei Sospiri (Bridge of Sighs) is a popular place to kiss your beloved as a gondolier guides you through the city's canals. But the sighs that the name refers to aren't from staring into your darling's eyes. The enclosed bridge, completed in 1600, connects the Prigioni Nuove (New Prison) to the interrogation rooms in the Doge's Palace, and it is said that a prisoner's last look at beautiful Venice would be from that bridge. And that's reason enough to sigh indeed.
